intro: Ferula lipskyi, commonly known as the Crimean cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its tall, slender stem can reach up to 2 meters in height, supporting clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. The roots of Ferula lipskyi contain compounds that have been studied for their potential medicinal properties.
